channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: World’s largest sovereign wealth fund posts $76 billion in third-quarter profit
item.description: Norway's gigantic sovereign wealth fund on Tuesday reported third-quarter profit of 835 billion kroner ($76.3 billion).

item.title: Russia pushes 'new world order' agenda as it hosts beefed-up BRICS summit
item.description: Russia is rolling out the red carpet to its allies on Tuesday as it hosts the latest BRICS summit in a show of strength to the West.

item.title: HSBC embarks on major restructuring, names first female CFO
item.description: HSBC has unveiled a major overhaul, announcing a new geographic setup, consolidated operations and a new CFO — the lender's first female finance chief.

item.title: More startups are being spun out of Klarna than any other European fintech unicorn
item.description: Alumni from Klarna have gone on to create 62 new startups — more than any other fintech unicorn in Europe, according to a new report from VC firm Accel.

item.title: Hyundai Motor India's shares drop nearly 7% on trading debut after record IPO
item.description: Hyundai Motor India shares fell nearly 7% on their trading debut Tuesday after a record $3.3 billion initial public offering.

item.title: Economists see UK cutting interest rates more substantially as inflation pressures ease
item.description: Economists at Goldman Sachs forecast the Bank of England's key rate falling to 2.75% by November, well below market pricing.

item.title: 'New bullish phase'? As gold hits another high, analysts say more records are in sight
item.description: Gold is now in a new bullish phase after prices hit a record high, said Sprott Asset Management, echoing other bullish calls for the bullion to scale new highs.

item.title: ‘They want something different’: Two reports predict a big shift in travel behavior in 2025
item.description: Trend reports from Expedia and Booking.com show vacationers are forgoing splashy trips to global hot spots in favor of lesser-known places.

item.title: He's British, she's Australian. Here's their trick to traveling 10,000 miles — with kids in tow
item.description: Stopovers break up the distance. But there are pros and cons to scheduling short trips in cities like Seoul, Bangkok, Dubai and Singapore.

item.title: Rosé and Bruno Mars' chart-topping track APT drives shares of media firm YG Plus to seven-month high
item.description: The track reached the top of Spotify's Top 50 Global playlist.

item.title: U.S. proposals to curb AI, semiconductor investment into China under final review
item.description: The proposals are part of the Joe Biden administration's efforts to restrict the flow of U.S. capital, technology and expertise into China.

item.title: China tightens export controls for tech and goods with military use, ahead of Xi's trip to Russia
item.description: China unveiled a set of regulations on export control of goods and technologies that could be used for military purposes.

item.title: Microsoft to roll out new autonomous AI agents next month, fending off challenge from Salesforce
item.description: Microsoft will allow organizations to create their own autonomous AI agents within Copilot starting next month.

item.title: Britain faces warnings of a tech exodus over tax plans ahead of high-stakes budget
item.description: Technology bosses and investors warn the U.K. could face an exodus of entrepreneurs if the government hikes capital gains tax — a levy on investment profits.

item.title: Disney will name Bob Iger's replacement in early 2026; James Gorman to become board chair next year
item.description: Former Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman will replace Nike Executive Chairman Mark Parker as chairman in January.

item.title: China cuts benchmark lending rates by 25 basis points
item.description: The move was expected. China's central bank governor indicated last week that the loan prime rates would be lowered.

item.title: Trump sued by Central Park Five for defamation over claims made during Harris debate
item.description: Donald Trump was previously successfully sued for defamation by the writer E. Jean Carroll in connection with her claim that he raped her.

item.title: McDonald's tells U.S. restaurants it's not a 'political brand' after Trump visit
item.description: McDonald's said it is not endorsing a presidential candidate after Trump's visit to one of its restaurants.

item.title: The next big career track at business schools: Family offices
item.description: Top universities are launching a number of programs and courses aimed at training the next generation of family office leaders.

item.title: Russia and Europe tussle for Moldova, as just over 50% vote 'yes' on future EU membership
item.description: Moldova's political destiny is hanging in the balance Monday after key votes on whether to embrace a future with Europe, or to remain within Russia's orbit.

item.title: Iran aided Russia against Ukraine. Now it needs to call in the favor
item.description: Iran could do with assistance from its powerful ally, Russia. The extent to which Moscow can — and will — help is uncertain, however.

item.title: Robinhood rolls out high-risk margin trading in the UK after getting regulator nod
item.description: Robinhood said Monday that it's rolling out margin investing — or the ability for investors to borrow cash to augment their trades — in the U.K.

item.title: Three in four Europeans support the use of AI by police and military, study says
item.description: Most Europeans support the use of AI technologies like facial recognition by the police and military for surveillance, a report from IE University found.

item.title: Boeing machinists to vote on new proposal with 35% raises that could end strike
item.description: The IAM will vote Wednesday on the new proposal which includes 35% wage increases over four years, a higher signing bonus of $7,000 and more.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Everyone’s watching Netflix shares
item.description: Many of us like to watch Netflix shows. But with the company’s dominance in the media and streaming industry, its stock, too, is worth watching.

item.title: Here's why inflation may look like it's easing but is still a huge problem
item.description: By nearly every barometer, inflation is still well above where most Americans, and in fact some Fed officials, feel comfortable.

item.title: Perplexity AI seeks valuation of about $9 billion in new funding round
item.description: Perplexity started the year with a roughly $500 million valuation and has continued attracting significant investor interest alongside the generative AI boom.

item.title: China needs stimulus with 'beautiful deleveraging' to avoid debt crisis, says Ray Dalio
item.description: China must employ a “beautiful deleveraging” in addition to its recent stimulus measures in order to avoid debt crisis, says Ray Dalio.

item.title: D.E. Shaw, Mantle Ridge zero in on key fixes to build shareholder value at Air Products
item.description: Both activists want to address CEO succession planning and capital allocation at the company.

item.title: Nvidia, Google, Microsoft and more head to Las Vegas to tout health-care AI tools
item.description: Tech companies are in Las Vegas this week to talk health-care AI at the HLTH conference.
